name: Yann Chevaleyre
content: homepage Yann Chevaleyre I am Full Professor in computer science at Dauphine PSL, researcher in Artificial Intelligence. News Research positions. 1 PhD and 1 postdoc position on robustness in AI Research Interests Machine Learning Reinforcement Learning and Imitation in Robotics Game Theory, Multiagent Systems and Computational Social Choice Current Teaching Activities Advanced Topics in Machine Learning, M2 IASD Introduction to Machine Learning, M1 I2D Short Bio since 2024: responsible of the Data Science team in Lamsade with Khalid Belhajjame since 2017 : Full professor at LAMSADE, university of Paris Dauphine 2010 : Full professor at LIPN, head of the machine learning team 2002 : Assistant Professor at LAMSADE. 2001 : PhD in machine learning at LIP6 A Few Recent Publications Lucas Gnecco Heredia, Matteo Sammut, Muni Sreenivas Pydi, Rafael Pinot, benjamin negrevergne, Yann Chevaleyre, Unveiling the Role of Randomization in Multiclass Adversarial Classification: Insights from Graph Theory (AISTATS 2025) LÃ©o Dana, Muni Sreenivas Pydi, Yann Chevaleyre, Memorization in Attention-only Transformers (AISTATS 2025) Alexandre Verine, Muni Sreenivas Pydi, Benjamin Negrevergne, Yann Chevaleyre, Optimal Budgeted Rejection Sampling for Generative Models (AISTATS 2024) Florian Le Bronnec, Alexandre Verine, Benjamin Negrevergne, Yann Chevaleyre, Alexandre Allauzen Exploring Precision and Recall to assess the quality and diversity of LLMs (ACL 2024) Alexandre Verine, benjamin negrevergne, Muni Sreenivas Pydi, Yann Chevaleyre, Precision-Recall Divergence Optimization for Generative Modeling with GANs and Normalizing Flows (Neurips 2023). Lucas Gnecco Heredia, Muni Sreenivas Pydi, Laurent Meunier, benjamin negrevergne, Yann Chevaleyre, On the Role of Randomization in Adversarially Robust Classification (Spotlight at Neurips 2023). (CIFRE with Huawei) Raphael Ettedgui, working on Game Theory and Adversarial Attacks co-supervised with Jamal Atif and Rafael Pinot Alexis Duburcq, working on Machine Learning and Reinforcement Learning for Exoskeleton trajectory optimization. (CIFRE with WanderCraft).
